sentence.Network_en: Why don't you just cut the crap and open the door.
sentence.Network_cn: 你为什么不能停止废话去把门打开。

sentence.Network_en: It is a tedious, humourless load of crap.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是一堆枯燥乏味、毫无幽默感的废话。

jx.jx_en_mean: talk at length in a foolish or boring way

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: related to Dutch krappe, from krappen 'pluck or cut off', and perhaps also to Old French crappe 'siftings', Anglo-Latin crappa 'chaff'. The original sense was 'chaff', later 'residue from rendering fat', also 'dregs of beer'. Current senses date from the late 19th cent

entry.tran: 错误的;质量差的;蹩脚的
entry.def: If you describe something as crap, you think that it is wrong or of very poor quality.
Crap is sometimes used to refer to faeces.
To crap means to get rid of faeces from your body.

entry.tran: (主要流行于北美洲的)双骰子赌博游戏
entry.def: Craps or crap is a gambling game, played mainly in North America, in which you throw two dice and bet what the total will be.

example.ex: I'll shoot some craps or play some blackjack.
example.tran: 我要掷几把骰子，玩几把21点纸牌。
